direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what's in here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody come, this way and we should be safe. Hurry, please.... INT. FIRST CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT Imam shepherds them into a container. The door slams closed. At first, only the sound of MOUTHS SUCKING BREATHERS. Then a SCRATCHING. Johns fumbles with a cutting torch. Gets it burning. Adjusts the gasses to illuminate... The door. Scythe-like blades are probing joints. Suddenly HEAVY BLOWS drive everyone back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you do sumpin' else with that? 'Sides holding it in my fucking face? Taking the hint, Johns starts cutting the common wall between containers. It's a race between the sparks of his cutter and the blades of the predators. INT. SECOND CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT An burn-outline appears in the common wall. Johns kicks out the escape hatch. Audrey speed-crawls through first as... INT. FIRST CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT Predators shred into the container right behind them, CLICKING, sweeping, hunting. INT. THIRD/FOURTH CONTAINERS - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT SERIES OF SHOTS: Again and again, they burn a new escape hatch just as the predators break into the container being vacated, always entering darkness. INT. FIFTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT Inside their fifth container now, Johns torches away. Fry and Paris use cargo to block the entrance hole -- then block the cargo with their bodies. Riddick adds his weight -- until he notices pepper-shot in the cargo. Suspecting the worst, he leaves the others behind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, hello? ...and moves to the front of the container where darkness prevails. Something SQUISHES underfoot. He slips off goggles. RIDDICK'S POV: Of dead hatchlings on the floor. This is the open container , the one where Johns found predators. Sensing energy, Riddick lifts his face. RIDDICK'S POV: Of an adolescent predator. It squats atop cargo, eating a hatchling. A heavy bone-blade crowns its skull. Sensing Riddick, it sweeps the area with INQUISITIVE CLICKS. PREDATOR POV: Of Riddick. (NOTE: The PREDATOR POV is a crude image that gives impression without detail. We're "seeing" what the predator hears with echo-location. Think of a sonagram that strobes and wraps its subject in 3-D space.) Oblivious, the others kick out the new escape hatch. Audrey, Fry, and Johns worm through. Imam and Pilgrim #2 hang back. "Where's Riddick?" He's in a stare-down with a predator . Searching, Pilgrim #2 rounds a corner -- and finds his head caught in a vice-like grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. Move. RIDDICK'S POV: As a second predator appears above them. This one reaches down with its scythe blade... And gently probes the two men. It wants know what they're made of. CLOSE on the pilgrim's shoes. Over-running with piss. More blades descend, moving over them like surgical instruments. One test-slices Riddick's shirt. INT. SIXTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT In the next container, Fry waits anxiously. Hissing through the escape hatch:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imam? Where are they? INT. FIFTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT CLOSE on a predator's scythe blade. It test-slices the pilgrim's skin. Blood wells up. All CLICKING CEASES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hasan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riddick? TIGHT on the pilgrim -- more scared now that the clicking has stopped. Losing his nerve, he bolts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.... The predators are on him , just blurs in the dark. DEATH-SCREAM. RIDDICK'S POV: A third predator appears above him. Making his move, Riddick darts around cargo and heads for the escape hatch as... Fry's light catches him square in the face. Blinded, Riddick HOWLS and stumbles forward. Fry's light leaps deeper to hit... The predator right behind him . With a similar reaction, the beast HOWLS and flails back. HOLD on Fry for a time-stopped moment. What stopped it? Was it really her? Suddenly a SHOTGUN EXPLODES beside her head. Jacked up, Johns is BLASTING shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, stop it, STOP IT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Sokay, 'sokay. I killed it. They give him a look. "Sure you did." Suddenly a CARCASS SLAMS to the floor , sending everyone jumping back in a perfect splash- pattern. "Christ, he did kill one." Fry reclaims her dropped light and beams it on the carcass. Wherever the light strikes it, the flesh chars and steams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like the light is scalding it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It hurts them. Light actually hurts them.... VULTURE SOUNDS from the two O.S. adolescents, fighting over the scraps of the pilgrim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that...Hasan? Riddick nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll burn a candle for him later. C'mon. INT. SIXTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT Cargo has been shoved against the door and walls. The survivors gather around Fry's handlight. Audrey -- tough little Audrey -- has been reduced to a shivering lump of mush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...one cutting torch...one handlight here, two more in the cabin...I think two more....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spirits. Anything over 45 proof burns well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many bottles?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not sure. Ten?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those umbrellas, the ones that mist. Would they burn? (reading his face) If you got a receipt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Possibly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awright. So maybe we'll have enough light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough for what? Now she challenges him to be the mind-reader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, lady. If you're in your right mind, I pray you go insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can stick to the plan. If we get four cells back to the skiff, we're off this rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate to kill a beautiful theory with an ugly fact, but that sand-cat won't run at night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to carry the cells...drag them...whatever it takes. Troubled faces. Is it just our imagination? Or is the light on the floor growing dimmer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean...tonight? With all those things still out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure. Why not? Sounds like a hoot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back it up. How long can this last? Few minutes? Couple hours? No one knows for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had the impression...from the model... that the two planets were moving as one. That there would be...a lasting darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those suns gotta come back sometime . And if these animals really are phobic about light, we just sit tight till then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure that's what someone else said. Locked inside that coring room. A persuasive thought. Eyes swing back to Audrey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, we gotta think about everyone now -- the kid especially. How scared is she gonna be out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke screen for what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For your own fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Why don't you rag your hole for two seconds and let someone else come up with a plan that doesn't involve MASS SUICIDE? Two seconds pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you weigh, Johns?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's it matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kilos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're 79 kilos of gutless white meat, and that's why you can't come up with a better plan. He makes a move for her. Riddick blocks. Johns' shotgun bumps the underside of Riddick's chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about that reward, Johns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm willing to take a cut in pay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout a cut in your gut? Johns looks down. CAMERA DROPS to reveal the shiv Riddick holds, poised for evisceration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Trash Baby, you're gonna regret this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please...this solves nothing...please.... Johns backs off first. The light grows dimmer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're afraid of our light. That means we don't have to be so afraid of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're certain you can find the way back? Even in the dark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not. But he can. She's pointing, of course, to Riddick. EXT. PLANET - NIGHT The eclipsing planet dominates half the sky. In whatever coronal light remains, we see clouds forming. EXT. CRASH SHIP - NIGHT Cargo doors crack open. Mixed for maximum flame, the cutter is pushed outside and swept around. Fry appears behind it. Moving like hostages, the survivors cross open ground, trying not to heed the PRIMAL SOUNDS beyond their light. Soon they reach... The main cabin. Blackness inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riddick. He lifts his goggles. RIDDICK'S POV: Checking the cabin. Finding a lot of wreckage but no life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks clear. Johns shoulders ahead and crawls in first. Just as he stands up inside... A PREDATOR BUZZSAWS over his head , fleeing the cabin, taking off into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said "looks clear."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what's it look like now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get the goddamn lights on.... They scramble aboard. Riddick TONGUE-CLICKS behind Johns. He isn't amused. INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT PREP MONTAGE: We see the survivors powering up cabin lights... yanking three more cells from the battery bay...threading nylon cord through Paris' misting umbrellas, filling the reservoirs with high-octane liquor...swapping out O2 canisters. INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT Reloading his shotgun, Johns finds himself shaking again. He unpockets a shell -- a red morphine shell -- and gives it a lover's look. Behind him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready, Johns. He palms the shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll lead you over the first cliff. You know that, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just burnin' light here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You give him the cells and the ship -- and he will leave you. He will leave you all out there to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it, Johns. What is so goddamn valuable in your life that you're worried about losing? Huh? Is there anything at all? Besides your next hype? (no response) Got no right to be so scared. Neither one of us. INT. BATTERY BAY - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT As hands yank the last power cell. INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT Cabin lights die. Still brooding, Johns finishes loading his shotgun in the dark. EXT. CRASH SHIP - NIGHT CLOSE on a burning wick. Alcohol mist shoots across the flame to create... A FIREBALL. Two umbrella torches, fabric already burned away, BELCH FIREBALLS into the night. By this light and more, we see... Imam chained into the first harness of the drag-sled. Beside him, Johns fumbles with a second harness. Hands help him into the chains. The hands belong to... Riddick. Both men recognize the irony of the prisoner helping his captor into chains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep the light going. That's all we have to do to live through this. Just keep your light burning. Riddick loops a handlight over his neck, places it to shine light down his back. A beacon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be runnin' about 10 paces ahead. I want light on my back -- but not in my eyes. And check your cuts. These things know our blood now. CLOSE on Audrey. Overhearing, she goes stone-faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riddick...was thinkin' we should make some kind of deal. Just in case, you know, this actually -- RIDDICK (shaking head) Had it with deals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I just wanted to say -- RIDDICK Nobody's gonna turn a murderer loose. I fuckin' knew better. It worries Fry. "If he doesn't expect to go free...."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been a long time since anyone's trusted me. That's somethin' right there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can, can't we? Trust you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually... (completely genuine) That's what I been askin' myself. He walks away. HOLD on Fry -- wondering if she hasn't made a terrible, terrible mistake. EXT. NIGHT The drag-sled begins moving. SERIES OF TRACKING SHOTS: Riddick running point, goggles off, eyes flashing. Johns and Imam pulling the drag-sled like malamutes, handlights sweeping. Pilgrims #1 at the first side- guard position, Fry and Audrey at the second, each position carrying an umbrella torch, FIREBALLS BLAZING. Paris stumbling along at rear-point, sweeping the cutter back and forth, every shadow a threat. They are a train of light. CLOSE on the sled. Holding four power cells and eight bottles of booze. CLOSE on Fry. Looking down. Noting sand-cat tracks underfoot. EXT. NIGHT Below us run the survivors. CRANE UP AND AWAY so that their lights become insignificant...so that we include, in FOREGROUND, the silhouettes of gliding predators. They're following from above, awaiting their chance. EXT. NIGHT FRY'S POV: Of the ground. The sand-cat tracks have vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you noticed too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riddick. Riddick . The procession grinds to a halt. Everyone sucks hard on breathers as they muster inside the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the sand-cat tracks? Why aren't we still following them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saw something I didn't like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such as.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to tell, sometimes...even for me... but looked like a bunch of those big boys chewin' each other's gonads off. Thought we'd swing wide. Okay by you? Paris looks over his shoulder. "We went around what ?" Nearby CLICKING breaks up the confrontation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's move. (to Audrey) Just a detour. He'll get us there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we switch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, switch what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I twisted my ankle running backwards like that. And I'm not sure I can.... (off their stares) Okay, that's a lie. I just don't want to be alone back there anymore. If you could just give me a few minutes up front here -- JOHNS She's the pilot, she should stay close to the cells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, so I'm disposable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll switch, I'll switch! Christ, just get this train moving! EXT. NIGHT They trundle on, Fry the new tail-gunner. At side guard, Paris relaxes a bit -- even though the CLICKING never seems far from earshot. A weak FIREBALL SPEWS from his torch. He checks the reservoir. Almost empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Light, please, need light here.... Still moving, Johns and Imam train lights on Paris while he refuels. For a brief moment, Audrey strays from the light. PREDATOR'S POV: Dive-bombing the girl. A HIGH-VELOCITY CLICKING: It's like an incoming missile. Imam lunges at the last nanosecond... And flattens Audrey to the ground. Scythe blades swing... CHINKING the harness-chains on Imam's back . Johns whirls, BLASTS. Light-beams leap around. But the predator is long gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please...have we been cut? Can someone tell me if.... He finds his dropped light, thumbs the switch again and again. Broken. In the confusion, Paris has been left in the dark. Something slashes him from behind . It's like the night has claws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sweet Jesus.... The bottle drops. The blood flows. The CLICKING STOPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sweet Jesus, WILL YOU GET ME SOME LIGHT OVER HERE! Faces whip around. But before their lights can rescue him... Paris is gone , snatched away by a swooping blur. Light-beams jump fitfully, vainly. RIDDICK'S POV: Of predators feasting on Paris. Carrying a youngling on its back, a female predator arrives late and can't find a place at the trough. With shocking apathy, it whips the youngling off its back and begins devouring it. Other predators start in-fighting, killing themselves for food. POV PANS to a pair of predators, closer, SOUNDING out new prey. POV PANS AGAIN to include the object of their desire. Audrey . CLOSE on Riddick. Trying to figure it out. CLOSE on Audrey. Listening to the HORRIFIC FEEDING SOUNDS. Oblivious to all the attention she's getting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see? Riddick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunger. I see 60 years of hunger. EXT. SKY - NIGHT As clouds mass. EXT. NIGHT Into a rising wind, the survivors range on. Audrey now carries Paris' torch, refueled and COUGHING FIREBALLS at regular intervals. Fry seems to be handling rear-point fairly well, until... The cutter sputters and dies. She ditches it and takes the torch from Audrey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bottle-count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four fulls, one half. That mean we're halfway there? I hope? Good question. They've just been blindly following... The light on Riddick's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we pick up the pace? Working like a mule, Johns growls to himself. "If you think you can do better...." Abruptly he slaps an arm across Imam's chest, spotting... A sled-track. In front of them. Fry hears a SHOTGUN RATCHET. She spins to see... Johns out of his chains. Moving forward. Jamming the shotgun into the back of Riddick's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We aren't completely stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay in the light! Everybody! Stay in the fucking -- IMAM We crossed our own tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's running us 'round in circles. Look for yourself. Look!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riddick? What the hell are you -- RIDDICK Listen . Imagine a hundred Geiger-counters next to a truckload of plutonium. That's the SOUND that rides the wind now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Canyon ahead. I circled once to buy some time to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About how to kill us and still get these cells to the skiff. Goddamnit, we're just doin' the heavy lifting for this prick!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What it's gonna be like when we hit that canyon. With her bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you jaw-jackin' about? Girl's not cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She's not. It hits Fry like a two-by-four. She looks at Audrey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want you to leave me there... back at the ship...that's why I didn't say anything....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we'd never....Oh, God, honey, you shoulda told me sooner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, this can't be happening to me....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They been nose-open for her ever since we left. They go off blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...we must keep her close, then. Here, she'll be safe if we put her between -- RIDDICK (scanning) There is no "safe." An epic beat. The wind gusts...the FLAMES CHATTER...their ears fill with CANYON SOUNDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not gonna work. We gotta go back. Johns brays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you're the one who got me out here, turned me into a goddamn sled dog. An' now you 'spect me to go back like a whipped dog?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was wrong. I admit it. My bad, okay? Now let's just go back to the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. Nice breeze, wide open spaces -- you know, I'm startin' to enjoy myself out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you fucking high again? Just listen to -- JOHNS No, no, you're right, Fry. What's to be afraid of? My life is a steamin' pile of meaningless toadshit anyhow. So I say mush on! Canyon's only couple hundred meters, after that we're in Skiff City! So why don't you just butch up, stuff a cork in that kid, and get -- IMAM She's the captain, we should listen to -- JOHNS Listen to her? Her ? When she was willing to sacrifice us all? A beat. Eyes turn to Fry. She wants to protest -- but can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he talkin' about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the crash, she -- FRY (a warning growl) This does not help us, Johns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: she tried to blow the whole fucking passenger cabin, tried to kill us -- FRY Just shut up, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tried to kill us in our sleep. Paris had it right -- we are disposable. We're just walking ghosts to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you RAG YOUR STUPID HOLE! She rushes him, ready to rip his eyes out. He shunts her aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not alive because of her -- we're alive in spite of her. He swung below the belt -- and connected. Fry's chin quakes, her knees fail. The undertow of events finally pulls her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We cannot go through there....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you weigh right now, Fry? Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, fine, you've made your point. We can all be so scared as you. Johns snatches a light away from Imam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Verdict's in. The light moves forward. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT They trudge on, slower now, building reserves for the canyon-run. At rear-point, Fry follows like a broken rudder. Pilgrim #1 now draws the sled with Imam. And up ahead... EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT Johns falls in step with Riddick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't all of us gonna make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just realized that, huh? CLICKING nearby. Johns BLASTS the night, driving the sound away -- and reminding everyone of who carries the Big Gauge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six of us left. If we could get through that canyon and lose just one, that'd be quite a fucking feat, huh? A good thing, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if I'm the one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if you're one of five? Riddick stares. "I'm listening." EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT AUDREY What're they doin' up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talking about the canyon, I suppose. How to get us through. Overhearing, Fry looks. It's odd to see Johns and Riddick walking side by side, like equals. Like partners. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT JOHNS Look, it's hellified stuff -- but no different than those battlefield doctors when they have to decide who lives and who dies. It's called "triage," okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kept calling it "murder" when I did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either way, figure it's something you can grab onto.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sacrifice play. Hack up one body, leave it at start of the canyon. Like a bucket of chum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sled. We can drag the body behind us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice embellishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't wanna feed these land-sharks -- just keep 'em off our scent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So which one caught your eye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don' look, don' look, don' look.... EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT Fry spots Riddick's look -- and Johns' non-look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imam. Slow down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't stop, just slow down.  Little more space 'tween us and them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would rather we all stay--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what I say. Please. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT RIDDICK What's her name, anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you care? Riddick shrugs. "I don't."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's not name the Thanksgiving turkey, okay? I assume you still got a shiv.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, you 'spect me to do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's one more to you? Like this is the one that sends you to Hell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're a piece of art, Johns. They oughtta hang you in a museum somewhere. Or forget the museum -- maybe they should just hang you. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT As Fry and the others keep slowing. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT JOHNS Awright. You do the girl, I'll keep the others off your back. Riddick stops. Reconsiders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, don't tell me you're growin' scruples.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just wonderin' if we don't need a bigger piece of chum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like who, Mr. Chrislam? EXTREMELY TIGHT on both men: In their eyes, we see the new partnership splintering apart: "Like Mr. Johns." Riddick makes a play for the shotgun . It BLASTS skyward. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT As the fight erupts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring the light!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're they doing? What're we -- FRY Leave the sled, let's go, go, go! EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT FIGHT SCENE: Johns' light hits the ground, creating an arena of illumination. FAST CLICKING nearby. Still struggling, Riddick and Johns somehow manage to gang-aim the shotgun and BLAST THE CLICKING AWAY. The shotgun goes free. Johns lunges for it, but Riddick kicks it into the night. And then pulls his shiv.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta stay in the light, Johns. That's the only rule. Johns circles inside the light. Fucking with him, Riddick starts poking and jabbing, backing him up against the wail of dark. Johns stumbles over something. A bone. A club. Riddick finds his own bone-club, and now they go at it like two cavemen. Riddick beats on Johns' club-hand, breaking fingers, forcing him to drop the bone. Just trying to get away now, Johns makes a desperate lunge for the light, but... Riddick shivs open his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember that moment? Gushing blood, Johns starts crawling pathetically with the light. Riddick dogs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoulda never took the chains off, Johns. You were one brave fuck, before. Now look at you. Oh, yeah, you were Billy Bad-ass with your gauge...with your chains.... Johns finds the shotgun . "And I'm still Billy Bad-ass." He sweeps it around with the light, ready to kill... Blackness. Where'd Riddick go? CLICKING behind Johns. He whirls to see... Something big coming for him . Johns BLASTS IT back into the night, dropping the light as he does. Eyes in the back of his head, he whirls again and takes aim on... Another bull-rushing predator. Johns triggers a bad round. Crazed, he ratchets and levels the shotgun for another try. He's too late. BIG CLOSEUP as the ejected shell rolls to a stop. It's red. Johns loaded a morphine shell in the dark. RIDDICK'S POV: With Johns skewered by the armpits, the predator lifts him off the ground and "stares" with a deceptively gentle CLICKING-COOING SOUND. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Johns' final expression. RIDDICK'S POV: The predator rears back its head -- then slams forward, hitting Johns with the full force of its skull-blade, splitting him in two. EXT. NIGHT Fry, Imam, Audrey, Pilgrim #1. They're running, stumbling, trying to backtrack the sled marks. Checking for pursuit, Fry looks over her shoulder... And crashes into Riddick . He was just standing in the dark, waiting for them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back to the ship, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of our way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So everybody huddles together till the lights burn out? Until you can't see what's eating you? That the big plan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Mr. Johns?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which half?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean.... Conflicted, they all look back. Audrey starts to puddle up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gonna lose everybody out here....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He died fast. And if we got any choice, that's the way we should all go out. (to Audrey, softly) Don't you cry for Johns. Don't you dare. EXT. CANYON RIM - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT BLACK SCREEN. We hear the canyon in full cry now -- CLICKING... BATTLING BONE-BLADES...MATING CRIES...the RENDING OF FLESH and SNAPPING OF TENDON. Far below, twin flames appear as the survivors reach the gauntlet. Predators perch in FOREGROUND, just hulking silhouettes "watching" from a canyon rim. EXT. START OF GAUNTLET - NIGHT They are but five: Fry, Riddick, Audrey, Imam, and Pilgrim #1. CLOSE on each face as they listen to the CANYON. There must be countless predators ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Audrey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three full bottles. But almost time to refill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't seem like enough to turn back on, does it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only see one way. Turn the sled over and drag it like that, girl down low. Light up everything we got -- and run through like dogs on fire. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sled as a shield....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what about the cells?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take those. She looks at him hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just here to carry your light, aren't we? Just the torch-bearers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's drop back an' boot up. EXT. BONEYARD - NIGHT START on the power cells. They're been lashed together into one queue. Working amid the giant bones, Riddick crafts a new harness from the old straps. Close behind him, Imam is MUTTERING IN ARABIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blessing you like the others. (off his look) It's painless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And pointless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. Well, even if you don't believe in God, it doesn't mean He won't be -- RIDDICK You don't see. Riddick shrugs into the harness, snugs it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cuz you don't spend half your life in lock-down with a horse-bit in your mouth and not believe. And you surely don't start out in a liquor store trash bin with an umbilical cord wrapped around your neck and not believe. Oh, absolutely I believe in God. And I absolutely hate the fucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He will be with us. Nonetheless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give my blessing to the girl. She needs a spare. EXT. START OF GAUNTLET - NIGHT The torches. Maxed out. Burning non-stop. Fry and Imam. Sled chains on. Lapping up O2. Each holding a torch. Pilgrim #1. Clutching a handlight. Audrey. Rolling under her sled-shield, becoming the turtle in a metal carapace. Riddick. Goggles on. He has no desire to see what horrors will surround them. There's just one path, anyway: Straight through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As fast as you can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you can keep -- RIDDICK As fast as you can. EXT. THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT SLEW OF SHOTS: Fry and Imam on the move, dragging the shield fast. Audrey speed-crawling beneath. Pilgrim #1 tripping along behind the shield. And Riddick behind them all, face already tortured, pulling 200 pounds of stubborn-mule cargo -- yet somehow keeping pace. The torch flames, stretched by the wind, flank them in fire. EXT. CANYON RIM - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT As predators launch from the rim. EXT. THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT First come the hatchlings, streaming right into their faces -- then veering away at the last second, repulsed by light. Next come FERAL SOUNDS overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look. Thin blue liquid spatters them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not look up. More spattering. Fry looks up -- and stumbles when she beholds... A ceiling of predators . At the cusp of light, they dive and weave and dart, slashing each other in a rabid desire to SOUND OUT the humans below. It's like looking into a bucket of angry eels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep going, keep going, keep going, keep going! His voice whips them like the Devil's coxswain. Chastened, Fry keeps her eyes down and speed up. More blue blood showers down -- followed by entrails dropping out of the sky. Could this be Hell itself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "So dark the clouds around my way I cannot see, But through the darkness I believe God leadeth me. I gladly place my hand in His when all is dim, And, closing my weary eyes, lean hard on him...." Now WHOLE CORPSES ARE CRASHING DOWN around them, victims of in-fighting. Fry and Imam start slaloming through the ghastly mess. Pilgrim #1 passes too close to a corpse: A blade slices his leg, drawing blood. He keeps his mouth shut. EXT. CHOKE-POINT - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT The passage narrows into a choke-point. Fry sees it first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Riddick? RIDDICK? Ahead, a clot of dead predators blocks the canyon .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a fucking staircase! Go over it!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WILL YOU GET ME SOME LIGHT OVER HERE

dialogue.raw_text: Trawl with it. There's a cable on the
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Steeling themselves, they start climbing. But Audrey, on all fours, has to discover the corpses with her hands . Then, taking exception at being walked on... One "corpse" snaps at her . Audrey recoils sideways... And tumbles down the mound of corpses. She's exposed. PREDATORS' POV: Rapid-fire images of Audrey. Flashes from 10 different predators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Audrey! Audrey shakes out of it and scrambles for the shield just as... A predator kamikazes onto the shield , its bone-blades piercing the metal... And nearly skewering Audrey beneath. Caught in torchlight, steaming, the PREDATOR HOWLS as it tries to rip free of the shield. Beneath, Audrey hangs on and takes a thrashing. The predator tears clear, spins, pounces blindly at... Riddick, standing at light's edge. Stunningly, he catches the beast under its scythe blades , blunting the attack. The predator CLICKS MADLY at him. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick's face. The predator rears back its head, ready to bisect Riddick with its skull-blade. Switchblade fast, Riddick drops a hand... ...yanks his shiv... ...and sweeps it over the belly of the beast. HOWLING, the predator falls, disemboweled. REACTION SHOTS of Fry and Imam. Stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't know who he was fuckin' with. They regroup. Imam's head swivels back and forth: They're one person short .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suleiman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the girl back under. Keep going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Suddenly Pilgrim #1 reappears , thrust back into the light by unseen forces. He's still alive -- but shouldn't be. He makes a feeble attempt to grab onto Imam, to anyone, but he's gone again before they can even react, jerked out of the light. Out of existence. EXT. THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT They flail on. And now, finally...finally.... The canyon widens, opening up like some door to Heaven. The WORST SOUNDS fall behind. We can see it in their sweat-sheened faces: The faintest hope that maybe they've survived the Seventh Circle of Hell. But then... The TORCHES SPIT AND SPUTTER. Audrey hears PATTERING on the metal shield. Blood falls anew. One torch dies -- yet somehow comes back to life. Imam upturns a hand, checking the liquid for color. But this blood has no hue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. No, no, no....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rain. EXT. THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT RAIN MONTAGE: Water rilling, running, flowing over rocks and ground. EXT. THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT Caught in a downpour, the survivors slog to a stop. One torch goes out -- and won't relight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where the hell's God now, huh? (no answer from Imam) I'll tell you where! He's up there

result.heading: RIDDICK KEEP GOING OR I WILL

direction.raw_text: Riddick? How close? Riddick sheds goggles to look ahead. We don't know what he sees -- nor what he's thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me the settlement is right there!

direction.raw_text: We can't make it. HOLD on Fry's anguished face, rendered in dying torchlight. Somewhere behind, the AWFUL SOUNDS RETURN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here...hide here.... He's found a crevice in the canyon wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside...inside.... EXT. CREVICE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT They crawl into the fissure. The second torch dies behind them. EXT. THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT There's just one light left now -- the one Riddick wears on his back. By its glow, we watch him lift the shield, muscle it over to the crevice... EXT. CREVICE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT ...and slide it over the opening. A black beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's he still out there? Fry's not sure. Is he protecting them? Or entombing them? EXT. MUDDY RISE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT Working like Sisyphus, Riddick hauls the cells up a muddy rise. He stops at the top, peers through the rain. RIDDICK'S POV: Of the settlement. Riddick disappears over the rise. The four cells follow, slithering through the mud like a serpent's tail. EXT. CREVICE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT AUDREY He's not coming back, is he? Fry checks Imam's face. Did Riddick say anything to you?" Imam wags his head. A bleak beat -- before Fry realizes she can see his face.

direction.raw_text: There's light in here. It's a soft glow from above. Imam climbs higher to discover small blue-white lights clinging to rocks. He plucks a few.

direction.raw_text: Larva....

direction.raw_text: Glow worms....

direction.raw_text: How many bottles we got? Empty ones? INT. SKIFF - NIGHT Riddick boards the dark craft. Connects the power cells to the battery bay. Watches the ship come to life. EXT. CREVICE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT CLOSE on a liquor bottle. It's half full of glow-worms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More, more, we need more.... They climb higher. Little by little, the bottle brightens their world. EXT. SKIFF - NIGHT Drenched in light, Riddick stands in the hatchway of the skiff, looking out into dark rain. Is he struggling with a decision? Or just savoring the safe harbor? Then very deliberately... Riddick smashes his handlight on the hull. He steps inside and closes the hatch behind him. EXT. MUDDY RISE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT Something claws its way up the rise. Standing, we see that it's Fry, a bottle of glow-worms strung around her neck. Ahead she spies... The settlement. Silhouetted by engine-light. EXT. SKIFF - NIGHT As the skiffs ENGINES WARM UP. INT. SKIFF - NIGHT As Riddick dabbles with flight controls. EXT. SETTLEMENT - NIGHT As Fry, running, splashes past buildings. EXT. CREVICE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT Audrey and Imam huddle around a bottle of glow-worms: This is all they could harvest. Presently SCRABBLING SOUNDS on the shield. Imam eases one eye to a small hole in the shield. He can't see much until... A blade rushes through the hole . Imam recoils hard, snatches up the glow-worm light to see... More predator blades exploring the edges of the shield. The light drives them away. For now. INT. SKIFF - NIGHT Riddick dims interior lights, activates exterior lights. He's actually startled by the sight of... Fry. Standing in the skiffs headbeams. Daring him to run her over. Eye-lock. Riddick opens the hatch. EXT. SKIFF - NIGHT They meet at opposite ends of the gangway -- Fry in the rain, Riddick in the light.

direction.raw_text: Strong survival instinct. Admire that in a woman.

direction.raw_text: trusted that some part of you wanted to rejoin the human race.

direction.raw_text: I will not give up on them! I Will not leave anyone on this rock with those fucking things, even if it means -- In a blur, Riddick rolls and slaps a shiv on her neck. Is history repeating itself? Riddick's face, though, is strangely calm. Curious. Even gentle.

CREVICE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT MORE SCRABBLING at the shield. Imam cocks his blade back, ready to do battle with... Fry. She heaves the shield aside. Behind her, Riddick.

direction.raw_text: I don't hear -- He covers her mouth. RIDDICK'S POV: Water has pooled at the base of the muddy rise. A predator drinks there.

direction.raw_text: Doesn't see us...wait for it to leave.... RIDDICK'S POV: Another predator lands to drink. Then another. Their backs are to us, but the pool is turning into a major gathering place. Soon they all can hear CLICKING above the RAIN. Their nightmare is far from over.

direction.raw_text: Get behind me. RIDDICK'S POV: Of a half-dozen predators shifting places at the pool. A slim gap appears.

RIDDICK'S POV: Of a predator turning to "stare" over its shoulder. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick bearing down fast. The survivors hit the water like lawn mowers on legs, crashing through, scattering water and predators alike, managing to reach... The muddy rise. Audrey loses her grip on the others... And starts back-sliding . She CRIES OUT, turning the head of... Riddick. He catches Audrey as her legs hit the pool. He muscles her back up the rise and heaves her over the top, sending her slip-sliding down the other side.

direction.raw_text: You know the way! Not waiting for him, Fry and Imam disappear over the rise. RIDDICK'S POV: Of the predators. Regrouping. Crawling up the rise at us. EXT. SETTLEMENT - NIGHT Fry, Imam, and Audrey reach the settlement. They spill around a corner and see... The light of the skiff. EXT. SETTLEMENT - NIGHT RIDDICK'S POV: Ahead of us, we see Fry, Imam, and Audrey vanishing around the corner. BREATHING LIKE A RACEHORSE, we follow in their steps, storming around the same corner. Suddenly a predator is right there , right in our face. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick skidding to a stop. He snaps a look up. RIDDICK'S POV: Of another predator perched gargoyle-like on the building. It SPEED-CLICKS at us. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick slowly pulling two shivs. Bracing himself. Ready to blade it out. EXT. SKIFF - NIGHT Imam and Audrey stagger aboard. Safe in the light of the headbeams, Fry turns back, panting, waiting. Waiting.

direction.raw_text: Captain.... He wants her to board the skiff. Fry gives it another beat, eyes sweeping the dark rain. And just when we think it's over for Riddick -- TERRIBLE SCREAMS are heard from both man and predator: There's a helluva fight going on out there. Close out there. Fry snatches the glow-worms off Imam's neck... And plunges into the darkness, homing in on the SOUNDS until... A blade flashes in her face . She ducks and spots... Riddick. Bloody, muddy, he's down on his knees, still trying to fight off the shadow-beasts that swirl and slash all around him. Around them both .

direction.raw_text: It's me, it's me, it's me! She gets the light around his neck. Now we see his face clearly -- and see a very human expression there: Fear. Fry grabs his armpits and tries to pull him up.

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Riddick -- said I'd die for them , not you. He gets his feet under him. Gripping each other, they start moving, turning like dancers in a macabre waltz, hoping the predators can't fix on Riddick's blood.

direction.raw_text: Just 10 steps...keep turning, keep turning...that's right...others're already 'board, waitin' for us right now...five steps...c'mon, almost there, Riddick... almost there...we're almost -- Something jolts them. ALL CLICKING STOPS. EXTREME CLOSEUPS: Searching each other's eyes. Someone just got slashed from behind, slashed bad. But who?

direction.raw_text: Not for me.... In an eyeblink she's gone, ripped from his arms. There was no scream. No cry. No final words. Just... Blackness. EXT. PLANET'S ORBIT - NIGHT Out of the blackness, a spot of fire races toward us. It resolves into the skiff, fabric wings burning off as it hits escape velocity. INT. SKIFF - NIGHT CLOSE on a bloody hand. It toggles through nav-charts, plots a rendezvous with "Sol-Track 17B" shipping lane. In the cockpit, Riddick finds Audrey beside him. She stares hypnotically at the stars ahead.

direction.raw_text: Not sure. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing.... Interior smiles. Stars sweep the windscreen as the skiff makes a course-correction. One very bright star comes into view.

direction.raw_text: It's more a place where souls are found, Mr. Riddick. As Riddick ponders the possibilities, we CUT TO... EXT. PLANET'S ORBIT - NEW DAWN The first sun flares out from behind the eclipsing planet. Its light feels cleansing. Renewing. Life-giving.
